summary: This is an internal FBI email chain regarding discovery obligations for the upcoming trial of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The email requests FBI personnel to provide contact information for victims, witnesses, and their attorneys to comply with discovery requirements, with a deadline of September 13, 2021.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the New York investigation, with trial scheduled for November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a co-defendant with Jeffrey Epstein in the New York investigation, with trial scheduled for November 29, 2021.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects in the same New York investigation and are scheduled for trial together.

events.title: Epstein/Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The trial for the New York investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin.

events.title: Discovery Information Deadline
events.description: FBI personnel are required to provide victim/witness/attorney contact information for discovery purposes by close of business.

keyFacts: The FBI's Victim Services Division is coordinating discovery for the Epstein/Maxwell trial, indicating active pre-trial preparation.
All communications (texts, emails, voicemails) with victims, witnesses, or their attorneys must be turned over to the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO).
The email highlights the procedural steps the FBI was taking to comply with criminal discovery rules in a high-profile case.
The document references FBI case number 50D-NY-3027571 for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The communication is internal FBI correspondence, showing inter-agency coordination between the Victim Services Division and New York field offices.
